Comments_List: I learned about Ancient Egypt through an examination of literature.
This course was  a pretty solid intro into the literature of Ancient Egypt and researching them for historicity.

I have gained a broader understanding of the variety of literary genres and each of their uses in ancient Egypt. I have learned to evaluate texts in their historical context and identify their purpose and their biases.
Lecture felt kinda boring because it was a lot of information, but I guess that can't be fixed.
Yes! Fantastic topic and well taught. Great workload distribution.

Well, since Christina is leaving I guess you won't be able to take this course. But if she somehow comes back and teaches it again, I'd highly recommend it. Not a very difficult course, Christina's nice as well as German, you might get to go on a field trip, and you learn a lot about the literature and culture of Egypt.

I would recommend this course to anyone interested in gaining a more nuanced understanding of ancient history, or anyone interested in ancient literature. There is a lot of reading in this course, so these interests, while not required, are recommended. Even if you have no previous knowledge of ancient Egyptian history, it is covered enough in class that it is not necessary and should not hold anyone back from the course.
